Explain ONE specific aspect of the manorial system that influenced economic activity in Europe during the 1200s-1450s

One specific aspect of the manorial system that influenced economic activity in Europe during this period was the practice of demesne farming. This was a system in which a lord retained control over some or all of the land and crops on the manor, and used the labor of the serfs to cultivate it. This created a system of subsistence agriculture that limited the potential for growth and innovation in European agriculture.
1/1 SAQ point, as the response gives an answer relevant to the prompt using real and correct information about the event stated in the prompt and gives a breif explination about the evidence.
